info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 08 at 11:18PM MDT until August 09 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... At 1117 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Kit Carson, or 20 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 25 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR highway 40 between Kit Carson and Firstview. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Kit Carson and Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 138 and 144. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
